paper_abstract: In this paper, we study the advice complexity of the online bipartite matching problem and the online stable marriage problem. We show that for both problems, inverted right perpendicular log(2)(n!) inverted left perpendicular bits of advice are necessary and sufficient for a deterministic online algorithm to be optimal, where n denotes the number of vertices in one bipartition in the former problem, and the number of men in the latter. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the advice complexity of online bipartite matching and online stable marriage
